 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֹּ֫מֶר‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==(idol-)priest== (so Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כּוּמָר‎</span>; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כּוּמְרָא‎</span>, is also priest of God; Nerab <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כמר‎</span> [[BDB#Hal|Hal]]<sup>Rev. Semitic 1896, 280, 282</sup>; Nabataean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כמר‎</span> ***priest*** [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>ii, No. 170, Teima</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כמרא‎</span> ***id.*** [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>ii, No. 113 a, b, b</sup> ***bis***; so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כמר‎</span> Neo-Punic [[BDB#Eut|Eut]]<sup>ZMG. 1875, 238, 239</sup> Berger<sup>JAs Apr.-June, 1887, 465</sup>; perhaps Tel Amarna <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***kamiru***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Bez|Bez]]<sup>BM.:Tabl, xxvi; Or. Dipl. 92</sup>; [[BDB#Wkl|Wkl]]<sup>TA. 1, 15, 33 leaves untranslated</sup>); — plural absolute, in O.T. only of idol-priests; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַכְּמָרִים‎</span> [[2Kgs.23.5|2Kgs 23:5]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּמָרָיו‎</span> [[Hos.10.5|Hos 10:5]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִםהַֿכֹּהֲנִים‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַכּ‎</span> [[Zeph.1.4|Zeph 1:4]]. In [[Hos.4.4|Hos 4:4]] Beck (in [[BDB#Wü|Wü]]<sup>142</sup>) [[BDB#We|We]] proposes <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעַמִּי כִּכְמָרָיו‎</span> (for [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעַמְּךָ כִּמְרִיבֵי‎</span>).
